post_text: Although the Governor reduced the restrictions for physical distance yesterday, we will continue implementing the NACS Reopening Plan as it is--6-feet apart or more to go without facial coverings. We stand by recommendations from local and state medical experts like the Allen County Department of Health, State of Indiana Department of Health and the CDC. #NACSsafety

We stand by recommendations from local and state medical experts like the Allen County Department of Health, State of Indiana Department of Health and the CDC. #NACSsafety

post_text:
In an effort to help families decide which school option is best for them this semester, we created a question and answer sequence with NACS Superintendent Chris Himsel and NACS mom/tv anchor Linda Jackson. The segments will hopefully allow you to find specific issues about which you want more insight.

Find answers to these questions at: https://www.nacs.k12.in.us/reopen

NACS Q&A Part 1 - What will Returning To School Be like?

NACS Q&A Part 2 - What Is Being Done To Make The Schools Safe To Attend?

NACS Q&A Part 3 - How Will Riding The Bus Be Different?

NACS Q&A Part 4 - Talk about Remote Learning and Onsite Options

NACS Q&A Part 5 - What Will Be Different About Remote Learning and State Testing This Year?

NACS Q&A Part 6 - How Can Students Be Best Prepared to Return to School?

NACS Q&A Part 7 - Will School Close Again If COVID-19 Cases Rise?

NACS Q&A Part 8 - If a Student Tests Positive for COVID-19 How Will Contact Tracing Be Handled?

NACS Q&A Part 9 - What About Families without or Limited or Internet at Home?

post_text:
Tonight's Board of School Trustees will begin at 7 p.m. with a YouTube livestream feed opening by 6:55 p.m. Access it here: http://northwestallencs.ss10.sharpschool.com/cms/One.aspx?portalId=21016704&pageId=21252193

The meeting will take place at Oak View Elementary this time to allow for physical distancing so everyone can safely remove his/her facial covering once seated. We ask that attendees enter and exit with a facial covering.

Dr. Himsel will present to the Board the NACS plans for reopening school this fall.

Parents and guardians, please note that the plan will be shared with you tomorrow, if it is approved tonight. If changes, are made, we ask for a little more patience as we make the Board-recommended adjustments, so check your email. We are hopeful this will help you feel more informed about what to expect with each learning option for the fall 2020 semester. #wearenacs #inthistogethernacs
text:
Tonight's Board of School Trustees will begin at 7 p.m. with a YouTube livestream feed opening by 6:55 p.m. Access it here: http://northwestallencs.ss10.sharpschool.com/cms/One.aspx?portalId=21016704&pageId=21252193

The meeting will take place at Oak View Elementary this time to allow for physical distancing so everyone can safely remove his/her facial covering once seated. We ask that attendees enter and exit with a facial covering.

Dr. Himsel will present to the Board the NACS plans for reopening school this fall.

Parents and guardians, please note that the plan will be shared with you tomorrow, if it is approved tonight. If changes, are made, we ask for a little more patience as we make the Board-recommended adjustments, so check your email. We are hopeful this will help you feel more informed about what to expect with each learning option for the fall 2020 semester. #wearenacs #inthistogethernacs

post_text:
Here are a few food pantry opportunities in the community:

LIFEHOUSE FOOD DISTRIBUTION Lifehouse Church will host a drive-up food distribution today, Friday, May 29, from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Lifehouse Cedar Canyon Campus, 1601 W Cedar Canyon Rd. This distribution is open to all families in need of canned vegetables and fruits, and other non-perishables, etc. Just drive up, share the number of people in the household, and bags of food will be loaded into your car. There will be NO distribution Friday, June 5. The next distribution will be on Friday, June 12, from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.

Wellspring offers FREE food pantry pop-up WOW site at Huntertown Elementary School from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m., Tuesday, June 2, at Huntertown Elementary School, 15330 Lima Rd. No identification needed. Please follow the orange cones for drive-thru access.

This is completely separate from the NACS meal program; we are working together to offer this service in our community. We know times are tough, and we want to support you.

post_text: Food Services has long been an invisible part of the school day, not anymore. The love and dedication our NACS nutrition workers exemplifies #NACSculture. Thank you, ladies, for your commitment to keeping our students fed! To help maintain their health, the department has divided into teams who work in separate areas to reduce exposure. They all have their temperature taken by a staff nurse upon arrival. We are taking precautions. Meals are being prepared today for distribution tomorrow. Check the COVID-19 page on nacs.k12.in.us for the latest information from NACS.

post_text:
Hello NACS family! We have an update again on meal delivery. Thank you for being so patient with us as we refine our process to keep your children fed and ready to learn!

In light of the Governor’s shut-down announcement and our need to protect everyone’s health, NACS is adjusting meal distribution. We will phase into a weekly distribution of meals this week. The next meal distribution will be Thursday, March 26, wherein we will have 3 sets of meals per student ready.

Due to the volume of meals, we can no longer insure allergy-free meals. We apologize for that inconvenience.

If your circumstances change, please contact us at (260) 338-0802, or email us at NACSmeals@nacs.k12.in.us.

DATE # OF MEALS
Tuesday, March 24 - 2
Thursday, March 26 - 3
Tuesday, March 31 - 5
Tuesday, April 7 - 5
text:
Hello NACS family! We have an update again on meal delivery. Thank you for being so patient with us as we refine our process to keep your children fed and ready to learn!

In light of the Governor’s shut-down announcement and our need to protect everyone’s health, NACS is adjusting meal distribution. We will phase into a weekly distribution of meals this week. The next meal distribution will be Thursday, March 26, wherein we will have 3 sets of meals per student ready.

Due to the volume of meals, we can no longer insure allergy-free meals. We apologize for that inconvenience.

If your circumstances change, please contact us at (260) 338-0802, or email us at NACSmeals@nacs.k12.in.us.

DATE # OF MEALS
Tuesday, March 24 - 2
Thursday, March 26 - 3
Tuesday, March 31 - 5
Tuesday, April 7 - 5

post_text: Our community knows how to pull together. What a thoughtful gesture by Preferred Auto!
shared_text:
Preferred Auto Group, INC.
March 20 at 4:27 PM ·

So it wasn’t the free lunch turnout we were expecting at our E State Blvd location today, only 32/75 free meals today were taken advantage of by those children & families in need. Don’t worry though, we didn’t put any to waste & decided it was best to take the 43 extra meals the The Rescue Mission!

We realize life isn’t all about work and selling vehicles at Preferred Auto. Now is the time our community needs to come together stronger than ever! Together through love, support, and positivity all our small local businesses will get through these strange times together! #PreferredToBePositive

We are still set for tomorrow at noon for a FREE LUNCH at our E State Blvd location! Hope to see more of you tomorrow 😄

🆓🌯 Free Lunch 🌯🆓

📍Where? ...Preferred Auto at 615 E State Blvd, Fort Wayne, IN, 46805
🕰 When? ...Friday 3/20 & Saturday 3/21 at noon each day
🤷🏼‍♂️ What? ...Free lunch
🙋🏾What’s served? ...Ground beef burrito with a side of applesauce
🤔 For who? ...Children in need under 18

post_text:
Yesterday Gov. Holcomb closed Indiana schools until May 1; our target reopen date is May 4. Remote Learning will continue. A schedule is forthcoming. The Governor also canceled the spring 2020 state-mandated standardized testing for this school year.

Together we will get through this. We will find our way. (from a safe distance)
text:
Yesterday Gov. Holcomb closed Indiana schools until May 1; our target reopen date is May 4. Remote Learning will continue. A schedule is forthcoming. The Governor also canceled the spring 2020 state-mandated standardized testing for this school year.

Together we will get through this. We will find our way. (from a safe distance)

post_text: NACS Food Service is already preparing meals for our students
text: NACS Food Service is already preparing meals for our students

post_text:
If you didn't receive a text message or email this afternoon, here is the link about how to reserve meals during the school closure: https://bit.ly/392LuPn, or find it at nacs.k12.in.us under COVID-19 Information.

We appreciate your patience as we developed a plan for our district. We could hit a bump along the way, but we will correct course.

Also, you can get a better idea of what to expect from this 3-minute video and interview with NACS Food Service Director Leeanne Koeneman, courtesy of Studio 415: https://youtu.be/bLTt4HQGzNk

post_text: For everyone's health and safety, NACS and the other Allen County Public Schools just announced we are closing our schools at the recommendation of the Allen County Health Department. It is our intention for NACS to reopen April 13.
text: For everyone's health and safety, NACS and the other Allen County Public Schools just announced we are closing our schools at the recommendation of the Allen County Health Department. It is our intention for NACS to reopen April 13.

post_text:
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we are following the recommendation of the Allen County Health Department and we are closing our schools beginning Monday, March 16. Our goal is to reopen Monday, April 13.

More information will be emailed to parents and guardians once it is finalized. We appreciate your patience during this challenging time.
text:
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we are following the recommendation of the Allen County Health Department and we are closing our schools beginning Monday, March 16. Our goal is to reopen Monday, April 13.

More information will be emailed to parents and guardians once it is finalized. We appreciate your patience during this challenging time.

post_text:
It's National School Bus Safety Week! NACS began the week with early morning radio show with FWCS and Carrie Wellman from 101.7 FM talking safety. We focused bus safety and avoiding stop-arm violations for drivers in an effort to keep all children safe as they approach or exit school buses. Take your time, drivers and be alert out there. Law enforcement is watching and we can do better.
#slowstopstay #NACSsafety

post_text: This news conference at the Northeast Indiana Regional Partnership was a grand moment for superintendents in Allen County and beyond as they stood together in solidarity with board members in front of media, legislators and business leaders explaining their purpose to educate the whole child and not to teach to a test. Because they remain diligent about this approach, they choose not to perseverate on ILEARN scores. We need to stop needless testing and use results to improve learning. We need parents engaged tho make a difference with policy.
text: This news conference at the Northeast Indiana Regional Partnership was a grand moment for superintendents in Allen County and beyond as they stood together in solidarity with board members in front of media, legislators and business leaders explaining their purpose to educate the whole child and not to teach to a test. Because they remain diligent about this approach, they choose not to perseverate on ILEARN scores. We need to stop needless testing and use results to improve learning. We need parents engaged tho make a difference with policy.

post_text: Mr. Lackland, assistant principal at Carroll High School, talks with Reubin Solis of WANE 15 about the Extra Mile Award presented to Marissa, a senior, who saved a choking classmate during lunch last week. The amazing thing is this is the second person whose life she's saved. Good luck at ISU this fall, Marissa! Thank you for your heroism! #NACSfamily

post_text: Carroll High School represented NACS so well today when Congressman Jim Banks was here. #NACSrepresented #NACSlovespubliced
text: Carroll High School represented NACS so well today when Congressman Jim Banks was here. #NACSrepresented #NACSlovespubliced

post_text:
We brought cookies and water to encourage conversation. Thankfully it wasn't a problem. The Statehouse was buzzing with senators, representatives, aids, lobbyists and citizens all passionate about their causes. We were blessed to talk with many of our area legislators.

As we chatted with leaders, we asked for more funding for public schools. We want funding to at least keep up with inflation so that we can compete with other states academically and so we can pay our teachers a competitive wage. 92.5% of Hoosiers send their children to public schools.

Now is the time to tell your legislators we need more funding in the education bucket...public schools are still behind.

Thank you to everyone who stopped to talk with us. Thank you, NACS parents for representing our district so well!
text:
We brought cookies and water to encourage conversation. Thankfully it wasn't a problem. The Statehouse was buzzing with senators, representatives, aids, lobbyists and citizens all passionate about their causes. We were blessed to talk with many of our area legislators.

As we chatted with leaders, we asked for more funding for public schools. We want funding to at least keep up with inflation so that we can compete with other states academically and so we can pay our teachers a competitive wage. 92.5% of Hoosiers send their children to public schools.

Now is the time to tell your legislators we need more funding in the education bucket...public schools are still behind.

Thank you to everyone who stopped to talk with us. Thank you, NACS parents for representing our district so well!

post_text: We were talking about driver rules of the road when it comes to school bus stops this morning on Fort Wayne's NBC. The safety of children is paramount. Please stop when the lights come on, speeding past a bus endangers children the most. We have seen too many injuries and fatalities due to distracted drivers or blatant disregard. Let's slow down on the road. This is a gentle reminder. Thank you for listening.
